English Version Overall Introduction There are two pages in total, one for the calendar and one for the quadrants.
Calendar Page: Used to record tasks that need to be completed in the future, divided into weekly and monthly views. Here, tasks are divided into four types:
Tasks that only need to be completed on the day without a specific time requirement, such as planning to travel on May 20th. Tasks that have a start time requirement but no end time requirement, such as taking a train at 1 PM. Tasks that have an end time requirement but no start time requirement, such as handing in homework before 1 PM. Tasks that have both a start and end time requirement, such as doing an internship from 1 PM to 5 PM.Â Quadrant Page: Mainly used for tasks with uncertain times, such as planning to travel on a certain day in the future, completing a learning goal. Here, tasks are divided into four levels:
Important and urgent Important but not urgent Not important and not urgent Not important and not urgentÂ Calendar Page Usage Components The calendar page is mainly composed of four parts.
Part 1 is the view switch button, which allows you to switch between weekly and monthly views. Part 2 is the calendar theme, with the highlighted date being today, and the circled number representing the selected date. Part 3 is the task display area, used to display tasks for the selected date. Part 4 is the add button, select the date -> click the add button to add a task. Adding Tasks Click on the date you want to add a task to, and then click the + button in the lower right corner to enter the task addition page. [
Clicking 00:00~00:00 will take you to the time selection interface, representing the time selection for the current task.Â The upper part is the start time selection for the task, and the lower part is the end time selection. Scroll up and down to select the time. The middle part is for describing the task content, just click and enter the text. The bottom part has the confirm add task button on the right and the cancel add task button on the left. Task Display Green represents tasks that only need to be completed today. Blue represents tasks that only have a start time and no end time. Yellow represents tasks that have both a start and end time. Red represents tasks that only have an end time. The number of arcs represents the number of tasks. At the same time, the color of the checkbox is also used to indicate what type of task it is.Â [ Click on the task (outside the checkbox area) to enter the task editing page, with operations similar to adding a task. Completing Tasks Clicking the checkbox represents completing the task, and completed tasks will be automatically deleted after exiting the app.
Additional Information Clicking the button in the upper right corner switches to the weekly view, with the same operation method as the monthly view. Quadrant Interface Usage Components It is mainly composed of four parts.
Important and urgent (upper left corner) Important but not urgent (upper right corner) Not important and not urgent (lower left corner) Not important and not urgent (lower right corner) Adding Tasks The selected quadrant will be highlighted as shown in the figure. After selecting the quadrant, click the + button in the lower right corner to add a task. The addition method is similar to the one on the calendar page, with the difference being that time selection is not supported when adding. The same, click on the added task to edit the task.
Completing Tasks Clicking the checkbox represents completing the task, which will also be automatically deleted after exiting the app.
